Regarding antibodies, plasma therapy using convalescent plasma from fully recovered patients is effective against these coronaviruses, including SARS-CoV-2.
108, 130 Tocilizumab (anti-human IL-6 receptor) may curb immunopathology and trials are ongoing now.
131 A study of novel monoclonal antibodies against the MERS-CoV spike protein suggests that mAbs can be utilized for the identification of specific mutations of MERS-CoV.
132 Wang et al. provided an all-hydrocarbon-stapled peptide that likely mimics the native conformation of the C-terminal short Î±-helical region of the MERS-CoV S protein, which can block the formation of the hexameric coiled-coil fusion complex to inhibit viral-cell membrane fusion.
